negotiator.parties

Class FeedbackHillClimber

  • java.lang.Object
    • negotiator.parties.AbstractNegotiationParty
      • negotiator.parties.FeedbackHillClimber
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NegotiationParty

    public class FeedbackHillClimber
extends AbstractNegotiationParty
    Hill climber implementation for the mediator protocol with feedback.

    This implementation was adapted from Reyhan's original code and refitted in the new framework

    Possible bug:
    Possibly, there is a small bug in this code, which you will encounter when running this agent for an extended period of time (i.e. minutes)

        public FeedbackHillClimber(UtilitySpace utilitySpace,
                   java.util.Map<DeadlineType,java.lang.Object> deadlines,
                   Timeline timeline,
                   long randomSeed)
        Initializes a new instance of the Party class.
        Parameters:
        utilitySpace - The utility space used by this class
        deadlines - The deadlines for this session
        timeline - The time line (if time deadline) for this session, can be null
        randomSeed - The seed that should be used for all randomization (to be reproducible)

    • Method Detail

      • chooseAction

        public Action chooseAction(java.util.List<java.lang.Class> possibleActions)
        When this class is called, it is expected that the Party chooses one of the actions from the possible action list and returns an instance of the chosen action. This class is only called if this Party is in the .Protocol#getRoundStructure(java.util.List, negotiator.session.Session).
        Parameters:
        possibleActions - List of all actions possible.
        Returns:
        The chosen action

      • receiveMessage

        public void receiveMessage(java.lang.Object sender,
                  Action arguments)
        This method is called when an observable action is performed. Observable actions are defined in Protocol.getActionListeners(java.util.List)
        Parameters:
        sender - The initiator of the action
        arguments - The action performed
